payload.draftBody:
Thanks for reporting this — the empty netcoreapp3.1 directory in the 2.88.0-preview.179 package was a real packaging gap and the thumbs-up reactions show others hit it too.

Since then, the 2.88.0 stable series has shipped and .NET Core 3.1 itself reached end-of-life in December 2022. SkiaSharp 3.x is now the current major version targeting .NET 6+.

Closing this as the affected preview and target framework are both obsolete. If you're still using SkiaSharp, upgrading to 2.88.8+ or 3.x on .NET 6+ would be the recommended path forward.
